Currently, I belong to Cilab (Computational Intelligence Laboratory).
My current research focuses on brain diseases, with an emphasis on graph-based computational approaches for understanding its underlying mechanisms. I am particularly interested in state-of-the-art methods for graph construction in brain connectome representations , including the development and evaluation of different graph-building strategies. I also explore graph neural networks (GNNs) for modeling brain connectivity, focusing on general GNN applications as well as the explainability and interpretability of these models. Additionally, I am fascinated by the mathematical foundations of machine learning, combining theoretical insights with practical applications to enhance both performance and interpretability. I am strongly convinced of the role and importance of scientific research for humanity, and I strive to conduct work that contributes meaningfully to both knowledge and societal well-being.

Programming. Programming is the key. From a young age, I was captivated by it, especially C programming. Since then, I have never stopped learning, improving my skills, and exploring the depths of Computer Science. So, I earned a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science and a Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science. Otherwise, I am a strong supporter of free information online, online anonymity, and free education. I believe everyone should have access to relevant study materials.
So, If you love low-level Programming, Deep Learning, and Mathematics, you are in the right place. Currently, I‚Äôm working with the latter two. So, I‚Äôm always on the lookout for new developments in deep learning, from new architectures to new ideas. In my free time, however, I also devote myself to the former, when I can!
